conclusion: Define the problem setup and variables.
Initial position: A is at rest, spring C is at natural length, rope is vertical.
Calculate initial extension of spring B using force balance.
Determine final position analysis with spring C stretched by 0.6 m.
Assume net force on A is zero in final position.
Determine A rises by 0.6 m due to pulley system.
Calculate final extension of spring B and its force.
Apply force balance in final position to find tension T.
Reinterpret condition to find spring constant k2.
Final answer: A rises 0.6 m, k2 is 200 N/m.
